prompt: Facts: The petitioner (Anoop Mathew) is the sole accused in Crime No. 702/2022 registered at Kalady Police Station, Ernakulam District.; The offenses alleged against the petitioner are under Sections 498A, 323, 324, and 506 of the Indian Penal Code (IPC).; The case was registered based on a complaint filed by the de facto complainant (2nd respondent), who is the wife of the petitioner.; Subsequent to the registration of the FIR, the investigation was completed, and a final report (charge sheet) was filed.; The case is pending as C.C. No. 1256/2022 before the Judicial First Class Magistrate Court, Angamaly.; The petitioner filed a Criminal Miscellaneous Case (Crl.MC No. 6283 of 2022) under Section 482 of the Code of Criminal Procedure (CrPC) before the High Court of Kerala, seeking to quash all further proceedings in C.C. No. 1256/2022.; The basis for the quashing petition is that the disputes between the petitioner (husband) and the de facto complainant (wife) have been amicably settled.; The de facto complainant (2nd respondent) filed an affidavit (Annexure-A3) before the High Court, confirming the settlement and stating she has no further grievances against the petitioner.; The de facto complainant stated in her affidavit that she has no objection to quashing the proceedings.; The learned Public Prosecutor, upon instructions, confirmed to the High Court that the matter has indeed been settled between the parties. | IPC: Section 498A (Husband or relative of husband of a woman subjecting her to cruelty), Section 323 (Punishment for voluntarily causing hurt), Section 324 (Voluntarily causing hurt by dangerous weapons or means), Section 506 (Punishment for criminal intimidation)
